intro: Triumfetta ruhengerensis, commonly known as the Eastern African spurge, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in dry, open habitats and is often found in grasslands and along roadsides. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
